alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 10:45AM MDT until further notice by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Riverton continues a Flood Advisory for the following river in Wyoming... Salt River near Etna affecting Lincoln County. .Mountain snowmelt continues through mid-week before a weekend storm system brings cooler weather. This will slow mountain snowmelt above 8,000 feet, decreasing flows on tributaries feeding the Salt River through Star Valley. For the Salt River Basin...including Etna...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt. * WHERE...Salt River near Etna. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.0 feet, Bankfull stage. Monitor high water along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Small creeks and streams are flooding in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of ranchland/pastureland near Etna. At 5.5 feet, Flood stage. Low land flooding along Swift Creek in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Low land flooding becomes more widespread upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of pastureland/ranchland. At 6.0 feet, Extensive low land flooding in northeastern and northern sections of Afton. Extensive low land flooding upstream in the towns of Freedom and Fairview. Minor flooding of farm/ranch houses upstream and downstream of gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Tuesday, May 30, the stage was 5.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain between 5.0 and 5.3 feet for the next several days. - Action stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay away from riverbanks, which may be eroded by the fast-moving water and could easily collapse. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
